stars.name: Sun
stars.description: The Sun is the star at the center of our solar system. It provides light and heat, making life on Earth possible.

stars.name: Sirius
stars.description: Sirius is the brightest star in the night sky and is part of the Canis Major constellation.

stars.name: Alpha Centauri
stars.description: Alpha Centauri is the closest star system to our solar system, located just over 4 light-years away.

stars.name: Betelgeuse
stars.description: Betelgeuse is a red supergiant star in the Orion constellation and one of the largest known stars.

stars.name: Polaris
stars.description: Polaris, also known as the North Star, is a key reference point for navigation in the Northern Hemisphere.

stars.name: Vega
stars.description: Vega is one of the brightest stars in the Lyra constellation and is relatively close to our solar system.

stars.name: Canopus
stars.description: Canopus is the second-brightest star in the night sky and is part of the Carina constellation.

stars.name: Proxima Centauri
stars.description: Proxima Centauri is a red dwarf star and the closest known star to our solar system.

stars.name: Arcturus
stars.description: Arcturus is the brightest star in the Bootes constellation and is known for its distinctive orange-red color.

stars.name: Rigel
stars.description: Rigel is the brightest star in the Orion constellation and is a blue supergiant star.

stars.name: Antares
stars.description: Antares is a red supergiant star in the Scorpius constellation, known for its bright appearance.

stars.name: Aldebaran
stars.description: Aldebaran is a giant star in the Taurus constellation and is often called the 'Eye of the Bull.'

stars.name: Deneb
stars.description: Deneb is one of the brightest stars in the night sky and is part of the Cygnus constellation.

stars.name: Regulus
stars.description: Regulus is the brightest star in the Leo constellation and is sometimes called the 'Heart of the Lion.'

stars.name: Spica
stars.description: Spica is a binary star system in the Virgo constellation and is the brightest star in that area.

planets.name: Mercury
planets.description: Mercury is the closest planet to the Sun and has extreme temperature variations.

planets.name: Venus
planets.description: Venus is often called Earth's twin due to its similar size, but it has a thick, toxic atmosphere.

planets.name: Earth
planets.description: Earth is the third planet from the Sun and is the only known planet with life.

planets.name: Mars
planets.description: Mars is the Red Planet, known for its reddish appearance and potential for future human exploration.

planets.name: Jupiter
planets.description: Jupiter is the largest planet in our solar system, known for its massive size and colorful bands.

planets.name: Saturn
planets.description: Saturn is famous for its stunning ring system, which consists of numerous icy particles.

planets.name: Uranus
planets.description: Uranus is a unique planet that rotates on its side and has a bluish-green color.

planets.name: Neptune
planets.description: Neptune is the farthest planet from the Sun and is known for its deep blue color and strong winds.

planets.name: Pluto
planets.description: Pluto is a dwarf planet in the Kuiper Belt, known for its controversial reclassification.

planets.name: Ceres
planets.description: Ceres is the largest object in the asteroid belt and is considered a dwarf planet.

planets.name: Makemake
planets.description: Makemake is a dwarf planet in the Kuiper Belt, known for its icy surface.

planets.name: Haumea
planets.description: Haumea is a dwarf planet in the Kuiper Belt and is known for its rapid rotation and elongated shape.

planets.name: Eris
planets.description: Eris is a dwarf planet in the Kuiper Belt and is one of the most massive known dwarf planets.

planets.name: Sedna
planets.description: Sedna is a trans-Neptunian object with an extremely distant and elongated orbit.

planets.name: Quaoar
planets.description: Quaoar is a Kuiper Belt object and one of the largest known bodies beyond Pluto.

galaxies.name: Milky Way
galaxies.description: The Milky Way is our home galaxy, a vast spiral galaxy containing billions of stars.

galaxies.name: Andromeda
galaxies.description: The Andromeda Galaxy is a neighboring spiral galaxy and is on a collision course with the Milky Way.

galaxies.name: Triangulum
galaxies.description: The Triangulum Galaxy is a small spiral galaxy located in the constellation Triangulum.

galaxies.name: Centaurus A
galaxies.description: Centaurus A is a peculiar galaxy with a prominent dust lane, located in the Centaurus constellation.

galaxies.name: Whirlpool
galaxies.description: The Whirlpool Galaxy is a spiral galaxy known for its classic spiral arm structure.

galaxies.name: Black Eye
galaxies.description: The Black Eye Galaxy is a spiral galaxy with a striking dark band of dust.

galaxies.name: Pinwheel
galaxies.description: The Pinwheel Galaxy is another beautiful spiral galaxy in the Ursa Major constellation.

galaxies.name: Sombrero
galaxies.description: The Sombrero Galaxy is an edge-on spiral galaxy resembling a sombrero hat.

galaxies.name: Cigar
galaxies.description: The Cigar Galaxy is a dusty spiral galaxy in the Ursa Major constellation.

galaxies.name: Triangulum
galaxies.description: The Triangulum Galaxy is a small spiral galaxy located in the constellation Triangulum.

galaxies.name: Bode's Galaxy
galaxies.description: Bode's Galaxy, also known as M81, is a spiral galaxy in the Ursa Major constellation.

galaxies.name: Cassiopeia A
galaxies.description: Cassiopeia A is a supernova remnant located in the Cassiopeia constellation, emitting strong radio waves.

galaxies.name: Hoag's Object
galaxies.description: Hoag's Object is a peculiar galaxy with a circular ring structure around a bright core.

galaxies.name: Cartwheel Galaxy
galaxies.description: The Cartwheel Galaxy is a lenticular galaxy known for its striking blue ring of star formation.

galaxies.name: Caldwell 81
galaxies.description: Caldwell 81, also known as NGC 3031, is a barred spiral galaxy in the Ursa Major constellation.
